explains: n. 愤世嫉俗；犬儒主义；冷嘲热讽

sentences.en: He was dismayed at the cynicism of the youngsters.
sentences.cn: 他对年轻人们的愤世嫉俗感到伤心焦虑。

sentences.en: The awful cynicism of this made an uncomfortable impression, and most of them began to look rather doubtful.
sentences.cn: 这种可怕的冷嘲热讽给人留下了一种不舒服的印象，他们中的大多数人开始露出怀疑的神色。

sentences.en: Despite such major compromises and transformations later, I think that Satan's cynicism to God before the defeat of the rebel angels makes sense.
sentences.cn: 尽管后来做出了如此重大的妥协和转变，但我认为撒旦在叛乱天使战败前对上帝冷嘲热讽的行为还是有其道理的。
